title: This Fallen Breed: An Epic Fantasy Adventure (Misthaven Book 2)
features: When the Age of Magic ends, then the First Men shall return.

For a year, he burned in the midst of God’s Challenge, but his torment will soon end. What will the half-giant Rootheart do when he is free to seek revenge? Magic will be lost to the valley and the Elvenswarm will come, with no-one to stop them. Unless it is Lady Alice, who must find a way, or see her people fall.Beyond the valley, Cavour is the Trytor’s man, and he must search the land for the legendary Wellstone. But how can he bring one back to the last Trytor, when he knows the abomination that will come? In his quest for Magic, Cavour arrives at the head of the valley to see God’s Challenge standing against the mass of the glacier. If he can find his way into the valley, then he may find that which he seeks; if he is not too late. With the help of BobbyJ, a new friend from the road, he walks into the mist.On Fairisle, Fleur seeks to strengthen her hold on Meldon, to secure the future for the child she carries. If she could see what was to come, she would surely cast herself from the highest tower.Can Ellaine Woewearer use her foresight to protect the land, or will she have more songs of sorrow to sing?This is the second book in a rich new fantasy saga. Full of treachery and tragedy, twists and laughter, unlikely heroes and evil villains.You can find other Fantasy books by searching for: Epic Fantasy Adventure Fantasy SeriesEpic Fantasy Boxed SetWizardEpic Fantasy TrilogyEpic Fantasy magicKindle unlimitedComplete trilogy Sword and sorcery Intrigue Dark FantasyEpic fantasy complete seriesSword and Sorcery bundlesEpic Fantasy Intrigue
description: "Yet another great read in the continuing story of Misthaven. Great plot and character development, along with an enticingly detailed world, make this a fun adventure with both a light and dark side. I can't wait to continue the journey." Amazon 5 Star review - Aron Masiker." High Fantasy at its best. Tolkien would be proud."Amazon 5 Star review - Debbie Taffinder

Then I'd write short stories for one of my older sisters to mark.", "I have to admit that I've spent most of my adult life not actually writing; life has a talent for getting in the way. \u200b", "But, since a pep talk from my son in August 2012, I'm now an every day writer.
